135343.content:
(This arc is in honour of the one person that voted on my chapter poll. Stay strong dude or dudette.)

If you’d have seen Marjorie Wilkins as she walked back home from the gas station you probably wouldn’t have thought twice about her. In your defence she was quite honestly unremarkable in basically all aspects. She stood at a diminutive five feet and was looked over by most she came across. She had no supermodel body, just some leftover fat on her stomach and hips from an unflattering period back in n high school. Her hair was truly her only distinguishable feature, bright purple and styled into heavy bangs that hung over her wire-thin glasses. Even if you had noticed her you probably would’ve labelled her as either your run of the mill art student or an outed lesbian. Both may have been true but the former was now just a remnant of a dream that had long been forgotten—it had been years since Marjorie had wanted to create something to better the world and she no longer held any love for humanity in all its forms anymore.

Her shoes kicked up some dust on the old dirt trail as she stepped up to the rickety old door. She pushed it open with ease. No lock was required. The dilapidated shack was miles away from the rest of civilisation, a disused prospector’s home hidden away in the middle of a destitute desert. Cobwebs attached to the doorframe withered away in the fresh sunlight as she stepped inside. She coughed solemnly as she pulled on the frayed strands of the outdated light fixture, watching as the light crept through the dust-smothered room, illuminating the aged brown furniture placed by the walls and scaring away a few insects that had been slumbering in the dark crevices of the room. Her conditions provided little comfort in terms of feeling welcoming but it was the best she could do on a freelance art graduate’s salary. The seclusion was also perfect for practicing her little ‘experiments’ without the fear of exposure.

“Frederick!” she yelled. No response but the eerie whisper of the breeze blowing through the back window in the kitchen. Marjorie called out once more, a threatening purr laced underneath her stern tone. A few moments later and she heard the familiar clack of tall stilettos increase in volume as she heard their owner march towards her. With them came an attractive feminine form, long and slender but not preposterously tall with flaxen blonde hair wrapped into an elegant bun and eyes of glowing sapphire. Their lips were of a pinkish salmon, drawn tight across their face into a solemn line. A pair of minute golden hoops were looped through the lower lobe of their ear but judging by the discomfort shown when they unconsciously fiddled with them they had not worn them for their own convenience. All in all they were looking quite dapper, wearing an ornate navy-blue blazer with a pristine white bow-tie and pressed black slacks. Their dainty hands were tucked into stainless white gloves with one holding out a platter of finger food whilst the other was tucked deftly behind their back.

“You called for me, Madam?” the figure said. Though their voice was soft and succulent in its intonations, there was an overwhelmingly distinct hint of the Queen’s English that contrasted with the Americanised accent they spoke with. The figure held out the platter to Marjorie but the purple-haired girl adamantly refused. She batted the plate to the side and rubbed her temples in frustration.

“How many times do I have to tell you, Frederick?! I don’t want any of your stinking hors d’oeuvres! You know well enough that when I tried to eat that first batch you cooked for me, I got violently sick and threw up all over the place! Goddamn, it’s like you’re trying to poison me!”

Frederick’s lip quivered into a sly sneer for a millisecond before he resumed his monotonous expression. “Why would one suggest something so underhanded and deceitful,” he asked, “if one were rendered dead, whether through poisoning or some other inexplicable means, how would I be able to perform the duties of my eternity of servitude to you?”

Frederick’s stoic expression melted for a moment as he chuckled to himself. Ungrateful motherf*cker, Marjorie thought. It’d been a few years since Marjorie had met the Butler and enlisted him into her service. Frederick had been the loyal subject of one of Marjorie’s first ‘clients’, an opulent husband-wife duo that’d migrated over to the States for the sun, sand and the endless opportunities to launder money through the more lenient American banks. However, the money laundering scheme wound up soon after a tense period of the IRS sniffing around and the couple had no use for an ancient, yet loyal, servant with ailing health and a spotty mind. After she’d properly found a way to leave undetected, she’d taken Frederick into her own employ, making sure to gift him a new form to effectively perform his tasks in the future.

“Whatever,” Marjorie retorted, chucking her beaten windbreaker onto the moth bitten sofa and taking an ironed white coat that was clutched behind Frederick’s back. “I don’t really care if you choose to be sarcastic or not because sarcasm’s not really necessary at this moment. Is the Coven convening today?” Frederick spun round in his heels and went back the way he came from and strode his way into the desolate garage, still grimy like the rest of the interior but not cluttered, with Marjorie following close behind him. He turned the dial of the thermostat on the wall, cranking it first from 21, to 6, and finally to 17 before pressing the on button three times in quick succession. The sounds of pistons firing exploded in the room as the cracked paint of the wall broke in the centre and opened up, the chasm widening like a toddler stretching their mouth to swallow a gobstopper whole. Inside was an elevator, spotless and grey, with only one button on the side panel pointing downwards. Marjorie and Frederick stepped in together. A white glove pushed the button and zoom the pair were barrelling downwards.

“Yes they are, Madam,” Frederick replied though little could be heard over the incessant whir of the elevator as it descended rapidly. “In fact they’re waiting for you in the atrium as we speak.” The elevator stopped abruptly as it reached the ground floor. You would think that the sheer amount of G-force would’ve sent both master and butler lurching forwards but the intricate mechanisms of the elevator shaft prevented that. Instead both felt relatively unscathed as they stepped out of the metallic doors and into the immense cavern outside. It was much like Marjorie’s own Batcave with menacing stalactites jutting out of the roof, dark shadows cast across the rocks creating a generally somber atmosphere plus a high tech setup of monitors and control panels set up in the midst of everything. Not to mention the literal swathes of bats that scurried around the place from time to time (Marjorie has actually imported those in herself. What Batcave would be complete without them?)

Marjorie pulled her hair into a messy bun and straightened her clothes as her associates came into sight. She had to, these people were some of the most influential...

She sighed at the cheesy statement as the door slid open to reveal a brightly log box. She stepped inside and pressed the ground button as the door shut. A second later a loud WOOSH! was heard as the lift accelerated, deeper and deeper 'till it came to a sudden stop and the door reopened.

Gabrielle stepped out, trying to redo her now messy bun. "That REALLY needs to get changed..." she grumbled as she tried to straighten her navy blue blazer and black pencil skirt. She walked past the front desk, waving momentarily at the receptionist Riley who ignored her and carried on texting on her phone. 'Kids,' she sighed.

"Mrs Bronson-Carter!" Gabrielle turned around to see...
14.title: No.4: Starting over

141.content:
... her employer, Dr Reginald Lockheed, standing stiffly, wearing an annoyed scowl and tapping one of his leather shoes on the floor impatiently. He sarcastically looked at a pocket watch that was connected to his khaki corduroy suit jacket. "Three minutes past nine, oh dear," he tutted.

"This is not a very good start for the day is it, Miss Gabrielle,hmm?" Gabrielle felt her face getting flushed, growing more red from both embarrassment and anger- she DESPISED how the doctor talked down to her. 'Calm down Gabby,' she told herself, 'Just suck it up and do your job, just like every other day.'

She gritted her teeth momentarily then replaced it with a fake smile. "Sorry Sir, it won't happen again." Dr Lockheed grinned in response, obviously relishing the feeling of power that her apology gave him. "All is forgiven my dear, just please do try to do the absolute bare minimum and arrive for your shift on time- tardiness doesn't look good for a woman in your position."

'...And being a massive ASSHOLE doesn't look good for a man in YOUR position.' Before Gabby could say something she would immediately regret she smiled one last time and went to her desk, angrily cursing under her breath.

Being the secretary for a self-centred egomaniac like Lockheed was nearly unbearable but, for all his faults, the guy was filthy rich and spoiled his employees with EXTREMELY large salaries. 'Probably trying to buy our silence for all the technological crap that goes on around here,' she thought. It was no secret that many top-secret projects were in production at Transforming Genetics, projects that some would happily buy for huge sums of cash.

Gabrielle sauntered through the large expanse of TGHQ, eventually walking up to her pathetic excuse of a workspace that was directly beside the men's bathroom. It consisted of an ancient plywood desk and chair set that were visibly caving in on themselves with stacks of unfinished paperwork that had nonchalantly been dumped on top, a small name plate holder that said 'SECRETARY OF DR LOCKHEED' in big bold letters and a dusty desktop computer that looked like it hadn't been used since 1995. 'Great, my home away from home,' she sighed sarcastically.

Gabby walked round to sit down on her rotted chair, the seat wheezing as she planted her left butt onto it. She started to sift through the files but after a few minutes the creaking intensified, growing louder until it noisily collapsed underneath her. As she fell she reached for something to hold onto, pulling the mounds of paper unto the ground with her.

'Awesome...' The loud crash had alerted many other employees, many poking their heads out of their offices to look at her and some were even murmuring and giggling. Gabby's face went flushed again just as her friend Diann ran up to her and offered a hand. "You OK, Gabby?" Gabby slowly rose, slapping Diana's hand away and responding, "I'm fine, thank you very much." She bent down on all fours, beginning the tedious task to collect the fallen documents.

Gabby instantly felt remorse as her best friend's face showed real anguish at her outburst. "Sorry, I didn't mean to snap..." Diann cut her off with an open palm gesture. She turned to the onlookers that were watching the scene progress. "And you nosy bastards better get back to work, right NOW, or I might get angry and, God forgive me, shove a motherfreakin STAPLER up each and everyone of your ASSES."

The people scurried back into their rooms like rats hiding from exterminators. Gabby looked back at her friend that had started to help collect the papers alongside herself. After a few minutes Gabby paused, quietly saying, "Um... thanks,Dee..." Diann turned towards her and genuinely grinned at her. "No problem, Gab. That's what friends..."

"BUT," Gabby interrupted, "I could have handled this myself. You don't need to go out of your way to protect me- I'm not the same person I used to be, I don't need a guardian angel on my back 24/7. I'm gonna handle this NOW by MYSELF."

Diann solemnly nodded as Gabby dropped down her portion of the collected papers. She could feel her face getting hotter as she stormed up to Dr Lockheed's office. 'I'm gonna give that pigheaded cockface a piece of my mind...' she thought as she approached the door. Slamming the door open she yelled, "NOW LISTEN HERE..."
141.title: Reginald Lockheed

1413.content:
Gabby groaned loudly as she stepped into the empty office, stomping her black stiletto heel on the floor angrily. She gritted her teeth as she saw a portrait of Lockheed on the wall, his frozen lips pursed in what looked like a mocking grin. Gabby sighed as she turned to walk out of the room. Suddenly, she whipped round and chucked one of her heels at the picture, tearing the face of her boss down the middle.

“Take that, sexist pig!” she yelled triumphantly. As if she was suddenly instilled with a newfound sense of confidence, she started rampaging, knocking down books, chairs- even flipping his desk over without a second thought. “You deserve this you old bastard!” Gabby laughed hysterically as she went and toppled over the ornaments carefully placed on his shelves. Exasperated, Gabby panted as she looked at the wreckage of Lockheed’s room. Panic set in as the reality of what she’d just done sunk in.

What the hell am I going to do! she screamed mentally as she surveyed the destruction she’d just caused. As if some otherworldly spirit came to answer her question, Gabby suddenly heard a childlike giggle echoing round the room. She whipped around to look at the source and was surprised when she saw a little girl lounged unpretentiously in Lockheed’s spinning chair.

Gabby was both terrified and intrigued: the little girl couldn’t have been more than about 8 years old, with her cute pigtails, her sucking on a red lollipop and swinging her little legs on the tall seat. However, she had airs of someone that was years older, the way she was sitting accompanied by the grey business suit that was perfectly tailored to her petite body.Gabby heard the girl groan as she pulled the lollipop out of her maw and lobbed it into the bin. “Uh, who would’ve guessed that trying to get rid of a 100 year addiction to smoking was gonna be so hard?..” the girl moaned to herself- although she had a child’s melodic voice, there was no mistaking the (albeit minute) smoker’s rasp she had in her voice.

The mysterious girl looked back up at Gabby, grinning unnervingly with a little gap between her two front teeth. “Hello Gabby.” Gabby stepped back in shock. “How do you know my name?! Who are you?!” The girl chuckled, stating, “Even if I wasn’t an (almost) all-powerful being, I’m PRETTY sure I would still be able to read a name tag.”

Gabby blushed profusely. “Ha, ha. Very funny. Now, we’ve got to get you out of here, little kid. It’s too dangerous for you. I mean, you’re what, eight?”

“WAY older than that, and please, this place is a lot less dangerous than some places I’ve visited in my life. Those German trenches, disgusting place. That’s where I first got my love of cigars.” She snapped her fingers and, much to Gabby’s awe, materialised a fat cigar and lighter in her tiny hands. She lit it and sucked deeply, puffing out loudly as she said, “I’ll try to quit tomorrow.”

Gabby was instantly both excited and petrified as she realised that this ’little girl’ was more than meets the eye. “Wh- Who are y-you?” she hesitantly uttered. The girl removed the cigar from her mouth as she replied, “Hmm, that’s a good question. Well, normally people I encounter call me Creepy Cloak Guy, Creep and Hooded Paedophile among other things. As you can see,” he gestured towards his immature body, “I’ve gone for a different approach this time.”

“So what are you? Some freaky, 8-year-old magician or something?”

The figure chuckled. “I prefer the term ’trait thief’, actually. I can do many different things but my main strength is in taking and collecting ‘traits’ from other people, either exchanging them with others, taking them myself or storing them for later use. Traits can be any body part, appendage, object or possession of someone else, mental or physical. Which brings us to the million dollar question, my dear Gabby, do you want to be a trait thief as well?” The girl reached out her dainty hand.

An hour earlier and Gabby would’ve said no and turned and run out of this room. But now she was filled with great rage and resentment for one man in particular, rage that could be fully exploited with a power such as this. “Let’s do it,” she stated solemnly as she took the hand and shook it. Instantaneously a chorus of voices sounded through Gabby’s mind, blessing her with all the knowledge about her power and being a trait theif.

“Woah,” she gasped. Gabby then heard a set of angry footsteps marching towards the office, footsteps that could only belong to one man. “Time to put your ability to the test,” she giggled maniacally. Gabby decided she would:
1413.title: ...to no one. Room's empty.

choices: Cut back to Diann’s POV while signing up
142.content:
Gabrielle turned to the source of the voice and seen none other than her best friend, Diann Dickson. She immediately smiled upon seeing Diann, and eyed down her friend’s work attire. Diann had on a short black pencil skirt, which really showed off her smooth, tone legs. She was in incredible shape, so of course she showed off the fruits of her labor. She had on a tight fitting white blouse on, that normally would seem plain and unflattering on most women, but not Diann.

Diann’s massive cleavage made it impossible for the shirt to be buttoned up to the top, so her bosom was on a wide display. This was the deal with most her outfits, even when she wasn’t at work. Gabrielle knew that she had some pretty big breasts herself, but Diann was in another league. “Sheesh” Gabrielle thought to herself, “She’s such a bombshell”.

“Gabrielle!” Diann exclaimed, “you’re not going to believe this!”. She sped walked over toward Gabrielle, with her titflesh jiggling madly. “Why, what’s happened?” Gabrielle asked. Diann greeted Gabrielle with a hug, and then wrapped her arm Around her was the started to walk together.

“So the research department was looking for volunteers would could try out some new product, and they offered a month-long paid vacation as compensation! So guess who signed their bestie and themself up!” Diann said excitedly. Gabrielle was surprised by the news. The research department was very secretive and never let most of the other employees in on what they were doing. This was a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to say the least.

“So when do we head over there, and what will we have to do?” Gabrielle asked. “Right after our noon lunch break! They said it won’t take too long, and we’ll be on the clock while doing it! The volunteer form said that it was confidential, so we’ll see when we get there!”.

144.title: Follow a different character

1441.content:
OCT 14, 22:00, TRANSFORMATION GROUP LAB, UNKNOWN, ENGLAND
--- -- -- --- --- - - ---- -- - ------ -----

It was eerily quiet in the English countryside as everyone slumbered except for one man, deep underground, who was hard at work. The man was ancient with a grey, balding head and a wrinkled, prune like head. His small spectacles rested on his nose as he relentlessly worked on something on the desk in front of him, his withered, bony digits twisting and moving frantically to and thro, picking up coils and springs and tools from his cluttered countertop.

"I'll show her," he grumbled quietly. "I'll show them all..." Reginald reminisced back to the morning before where he had sat in a conference room with his old adversary Ms McGee. As usual they had been having a heated argument over the company, she complained about the economic situation while he argued over the funding he was receiving or not receiving actually.

"Look, Reggie, listen, I've got OODLES of respect for you and your science-y stuff but I'm just telling you the hard facts; I've been pumping money into your 'project' for years now and you STILL haven't had a solid breakthrough yet."

Dr Lockheed sighed sardonically and removed his circular rimmed glasses. "With all due respect, Sarah, it shouldn't be a surprise that this project of mine has taken so long- even though we have some of the most brilliant minds on the planet, what we are trying to accomplish defies physics, biology, chemistry- reality ITSELF! This is a new frontier we are exploring and it would normally take DECADES to do something like this! You're lucky that we've done this much in just a matter of years!"

Sarah McGee sighed, knowing that Reginald was a lost cause. "Fine Reg, I know you've put a lot of blood, sweat and tears into this but you've gotta see it from my perspective; I've committed a LOT of cash into you and your vision without earning a single penny back. I know you're adamant that you're 'exploring a new frontier' or whatever, but it's reached the point where hard decisions are gonna have to be made."

"You've got to present SOMETHING by next Tuesday or I'm pulling the plug. That means no funding, which means no materials, no staff and no job for YOU."

She jabbed her manicured finger into Dr Lockheed's chest to emphasise her point and show she wasn't joking. Dr Lockheed's had now become pale and he gulped hard. He struggled to find words as his mouth flapped open and closed.

"Y-You c-can't..."

Ms McGee stood up briskly, straightening her black dress as she did so and picking up her black designer purse. She strutted towards the door but then turned around and said, "I can. And I WILL." She sauntered through the automatic door and stepped into the elevator close by and speeding upwards. Still recovering from the shock, an elderly Dr Lockheed spoke silently to himself. "My life's work..."

"RUINED!" He threw useless paraphernalia off of the table and clutched a small, beeping device in his frail hands. "Finally, its ready..." He slowly started to laugh, quietly at first but then it turned into a full blown menacing cackle that echoed round the late night laboratory.
1441.title: Reginald Lockheed

choices: Someone had been trying to wake him up
No one was there- It was part of his dream
He saw all the staff above him
14412.content:
In the early hours Dr Lockheed finally fell asleep. However, it was a weird type of sleep as he was conscious the whole time.

He looked around him and saw a background of soft clouds surrounding him, beige and brown in the early morning light. He looked down at himself and saw a young, fit body below. He realised that he now will inhabited the body of his younger self. He looked back up and saw what looked like a blinding light which must have been the sun. He slowly walked up to it, shielding his eyes from the blinding glare.

Suddenly he heard a quiet moaning coming from behind him that was gradually becoming louder and louder until it deafened him. He looked back and saw a black cloud looming behind him, narrowing the gap between Reginald and itself every second.

Reginald turned back round, sprinting for the sun, trying to escape his malevolent pursuer. He tried to run faster but something seemed to be slowing him down. He glanced downwards and saw he was aging again, his leg muscles becoming thinner and weaker until his legs eventually just buckled underneath him. The clouds swarmed, smothering Dr Lockheed and accelerated the ageing process. "No," he whimpered in his frail, elderly voice.

He crawled still, closer and closer towards the sunlight until he finally reached it. A wave of euphoria swept over him as the darkness was expelled from his body and his body reverted back to a young man. He was admiring his lithe youthful body when he heard a voice saying, "Wake up! Wake up!" He slowly opened his eyes and...
14412.title: He has a weird dream

choices: Skip work and test out the T.R.A.M.
Follow one of them round work
14433413.content:
"Oh my Gosh! Jake! Get over here!" Jenny hollered at her twin brother as she started jumping up and down in celebration. Unfortunately for her Jake had taken a quick power nap, so exhausted from working that he'd planted his face slap bang in the middle of the open bagel he was eating.

"Jake! Jake?! JAKE!" She finally realised he was asleep and vehemently shook him, failing to even elicit a grown from him. "Urggh! Jacob Jonathan Joseph Duckhold, you will wake up or I...I... URGGH!" She just couldn't think of a good enough threat- Jake had always been the devil to Jenny's angelic disposition. "Fine! You won't wake up?! Then I'll... I'll..." She spotted a cup of (what she hoped was) water and in a lightbulb moment picked it up and tipped it over his head (spoiler alert: it WASN'T water).

"HUUH!" he yelled as he bolted upright, the open bagel still stuck to the rim of his glasses. Jenny stifled a small snigger as he stretched out his arms wide and yawned loudly. "Wah... Wha's... What's up? Why am I... wet?" He went to rub his eyes and felt the stale bagel. "And why have I got a freaking bagel on my face?!"

She quietly chuckled before she responded. "Sorry about that, bro- you said you were gonna take a quick nap but you slept like an OX."

"Mhm... What time is it?"

"Erm.. 5:34 or so."

"WHAT! Please tell me you mean PM!"

"Sos Jake but you DID tell me to say when I'm done."

His head whipped towards Jenny as he seemed to finally wake from his sleepy state. "It's... It's done?! Like, actually FINISHED! Mucho completo?! Scoot over, sis!" He vaulted from his seat and bumped Jenny out of hers with ease. Although Jake was NOWHERE near a perfect physical specimen but he was 5'11" and scrawny while his sister was 5'6" and average sized.

"Urggh! You're so irritating! You and I both know it's 'realmente completo'! You're doing that just to annoy me!"

"Uh huh, yeah, whatever," Jake replied, not caring to even try and listen. He lifted up a small device in his hands and exclaimed, "After months of hard work and hours of meticulous tinkering, we finally have the... wait, why is it so small?"

Jenny face palmed with and tried not to let her aggravation show. "It HAS to be SMALL. Otherwise it would stick out like a SORE THUMB when you're trying to lug it around when you're out and about."

Jake just turned and faked to be hurt by her comments. "Well, SORRY! Don't have to be so INSULTING! Now where was I? Oh yes, presenting the new, revolutionary Duckhold joint project, the Trait Removing, Altering or Morphing Device or T.R.A.M. for short (patent pending!)!"

Jenny just looked on and giggled slightly at his TV salesman impression. "Madam," he continued, "I do not understand- why do you laugh? Is it the name? Well I don't suppose you have one, do you know?" The long pause and audible gulp from Jenny confirmed she didn't. "Well then, T.R.A.M. it is!"

"Whatever you want to name it, go for it," Jenny replied, "I need to catch some Zs before the work shift starts at 11 o'clock."

"Yeah, you look like you haven't slept properly in MONTHS."

"Uhm... probably 'cause I HAVEN'T!

"Alright! Jeez... Sweet dreams, sis." He turned round and saw that she had already curled up on the beaten up sofa they both shared in the office. He walked up and kissed her on the head before snuggling up beside her, reflecting on all the work they'd invested in the process of building the T.R.A.M. and smiled, satisfied at last.

144334133.content:
11:04am, Transformation Group HQ, Somewhere in the English countryside
- -- -- -- --- - ---- -- ---- --- -- -- -- --- ----
"So you're telling me," spoke Professor Reginald Lockheed sceptically, "that in the space of approximately 12 hours, your sister has contracted a HIGHLY CONTAGIOUS disease that threatens to decimate my staff number and render everyone else into, how'd you say it, mindless ZOMBIES?"

He was sat behind a mahogany desk in his office and opposite sat a very guilty looking Jake Duckhold whose perspiration caused patches of sweat to flower out from the armpits of his pressed white shirt. Beside was someone that you could only assume was his sister, Jenny, though it was hard to tell as she was swathed in a thick layer of coats, hats and scarves.

"Well, er, yes sir," replied Jake as he scratched his shaved sides with his bony fingers. "It's very unfortunate though sir, if the situation was flipped and my sister was on the other side, the zombies wouldn't attack her as she doesn't have a brain for them to- OW!"

Underneath a mountain of clothes, Jenny Duckbold stifled a small chuckle as she looked at her brother who was now nursing his bruised leg. "Ahem, changing the subject, she cannot stay for OBVIOUS reasons; I mean, LOOK AT HER!" He returned her kick to tell her to convince the Prof.

"Um...kaff, kaff!" She rubbed her arms for extra emphasis but still Professor Lockheed didn't believe it. "Hmm," he mumbled, "Well, I guess if she's REALLY that sick, she should probably be taken to a hospital right?"

"NO!" Jake yelled as he rocketed out of his chair. "I mean, it's just a minor hassle, no need to notify the authorities!"

"Please," Lockheed continued, a small smile appearing on the corner of his wizened lips. "there could be something SERIOUSLY wrong with her! Don't you worry Jacob, I'll take her straight away!"

"NO!" screamed Jenny's muffled voice. Professor Lockheed turned towards Jake and said, "I thought she was so sick she couldn't speak?"

If someone had caught this moment on camera at this exact time, they would have captured the astounding expression currently shown on Jake Duckhold's face: a mixture of guilt, anxiety, shock and anguish when he realised he'd been caught out. He'd been attempting to quickly devise an ingenious response when he suddenly blurted out, "IT'S A MIRACLE!"

Professor Lockheed relaxed back into his seat and let nched the bridge of his nose. Jake and Jenny prepared themselves for the inevitable onslaught of warnings he would deliver until he started laughing (it was not much a laugh, more a raspy wheezing), dumbfounding the pair.

"Ah, I really laughed this much in YEARS!" He continued to 'laugh' as he tried to explain to the two. "Listen, you think I would invest SO MUCH of MY money if I couldn't monitor my employees? I have cameras stationed in every room and hallway! When you guys finished your little T.R.A.M. device, I found out albeit a few hours after you. If you want to leave work and take it for a little 'test run', fine by me."

"REALLY?!" exclaimed Jenny, who was obviously not sick. "Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you..."

"You don't need to thank me- just send me some results and some pictures of what you've done. We can just mark it down as a 'field performance trial'."

Jake fell to his knees and held his hands together in a praying gesture. "Oh, thank you, Mr L. Can I call you that, Mr L?" In response Professor Lockheed gave him a ruthless glare that could melt the resolve of even the toughest of criminals. "Er, I guess that's a no! Goodbye boss!"

He slammed the door shut after him which caused Dr Lockheed's desk to rumble. He carefully adjusted a pencil that had moved slightly as he spoke to himself, "Those two are geniuses- awkward, naive geniuses, but still geniuses. Their invention could be HUGE, not only for the business but for me especially! I'll let them have their fun and games- however, when the time is right, I will come and take back what's rightfully MINE!"

144334133321.content:
(QUICK NOTICE: This is a chapter that I’d kept in my archive for so long that I didn’t even remember writing it. Apologies if you’re slightly inconvenienced by my older writing style in the first half of the chapter but it is what it is.)

Jake practically cartwheeled out of the decrepit barn that was a front for the massive, multi-billion dollar laboratory that was housed underneath, narrowly missing a close encounter with a picket fence that stood in front of him. “Oh yeah, who's the man? It's me, I'm the man!" Jake proceeded to do a victory dance of sorts, gyrating and flailing his lanky limbs about. He pulled a smug grin as he turned to his sister and said, "Oh sister dear, I remember a certain someone made a bet that my BRILLIANT PLAN wouldn't WORK, if I'm not mistaken?" Jenny rolled her eyes, begrudgingly pulling a note from her oversized khaki jacket and passing it to Jake's outstretched hand. "Nice doing business with you, sis," he said as he pocketed it into the back pocket of his casual black jeans. "Hopefully this will teach you not to doubt this MASTER MANIPULATOR."

Jenny scoffed, retorting back, "First off: you just stepped in horse crap." Jake squealed and jumped back, only just noticing he'd planted his white skater shoes in a large pile of... well, horse crap. "I just got these," Jake whimpered.

"Second, your 'GENIUS' plan was nearly as stupid as when you tried to restart your bunny's heart with a live wire next to our family pool when we were 13."

"Hey!" Jake interjected. "Mr Hare was my BEST FRIEND for YEARS, he was the only companion I had that ever really understood me... Anyway, all I know is that morning he was completely healthy and when I came back from school he'd SOMEHOW hopped out onto the edge of the pool. Funny, huh Sister?"

"...In any case, that whole 'zombie disease' nonsense didn't work.You’ve been watching way too much Shaun Of The Dead. You’re lucky that Dr Lockheed cares more about science than he cares about his employees’ integrity. You and I know he only let us go because he wants to see the consequences of our experiments with the T.R.A.M.”

Jake sighed as he pressed the beeper for his car. "A win's a win, Jen. Instead of nitpicking each stage of the vetting process just try and enjoy something for once!" He opened the driver's side door and hopped in, the worn leather chair creaking in protest. The car was an original Mini Cooper from about 1965, a rusty old relic that was covered in grease and grime from dozens of years of service and countless hours of repairs. Although it was supposed to have 4 seats, there was literally no leg room, forcing front passengers to pull their chairs back all the way.

"Ugh..." Jenny shuddered as she cautiously clambered into the passenger seat. "Why can you spend 100s of dollars on video games but you can't spend a few more to replace this HUNK OF JUNK?"

Jake cradled the tearing leather of the steering wheel as if he was covering an infant's child's ears. "Shush, calm down Minnie, she didn't mean it," he spoke as he stroked the wheel. "Let's get this show on the road." He turned the key only for a spluttering gasp to come out of the car's engine. Jenny gave Jake a look that all too blatantly said 'I told you so'. He turned it harder this time and the engine woke up again, wheezing and spluttering as if it had a cold. "See!" Jake laughed giddily as they pulled out of the hidden car park and onto the road.

"So..." Jenny said as she twirled a strand of her curly, tangerine mane around one of her fingers. "...where are we even going? Did we have a plan for what we would do if Mr Lockheed believed your bullcrap story or are you gonna make it up as you go like you always do?” Jake chuckled as he swapped out his geeky spectacles for a bulky pair of aviators. His foot pushed down onto the accelerator and the dilapidated old motor sprung into action, howling as it roared down the motorway. Jenny rolled her eyes and puckered her lips in frustration- it only the twin telepathy that they advertised on small screens was real. Knowing her brother though, she knew that either one of them would find a way to experiment on their sibling and pervert it into something that would suit themself. Her gaze turned back onto the road outside. Her auburn hair flickered like a raging hearth in the wind and she watched as the countryside beside them blurred into an indivisible wall of green vegetation.

Forty odd minutes later the Mini finally clunked to a stop. Jenny’d finally succumbed to her sleep deprivation and had popped off for a nap. She awoke in a messy bundle, her hair dragged all across her face and in her glasses and the raggedy seatbelt fastening her to the chair was critically chafing her pert nipples. She squirmed out of her seat and joined Jake who was stretching himself outside. “Finally awake, you sleepy bastard,” he laughed as he ruffled his sister’s hair playfully. “Hey, next time we start a project together, remind me to either cook up something to fix your breathing problems or design some noise-cancelling earbuds to cancel out your elephant snores!” Jenny punched her brother’s arm and walked forward away from the car. The gravel underneath her feet gave way to golden sand and, as her suede ballet flats took more steps, the background cacophony of voices became louder and more distinct to her ears.

“The beach? Seriously?”

“What’s wrong with the beach? Surf, sand, sun...” Jake’s dialogue suddenly trailed off as a appealing young woman in a racy black bikini strode past them. “...Sexy babes. Oh sh*t, the beach has got it all!” Jenny cocked her head to the side- her brother may have been more outgoing than her on the most part but in all truth his extroversion was as much a defence mechanism as her introversion was. Normally she’d take Jakes lewdness as a joke to express his awkwardness but with the T.R.A.M. nestled safely in his jeans’ pocket she wasn’t sure how long she or anyone else on the beach would be laughing for this time. “Calm down, Casanova, we’ve only just got here. Keep in mind the objective here is to field test the device and record them for...”

“Yeah, blah blah blah, future observations and whatnot, let’s go have some fun! I say our first objective should be to get that girl to be interested in me- y’know, bat her eyelashes at me, maybe give me a little wink or something?” Jame practically licked his lips as he watched the woman meet up with her female companion. “Isn’t that a bit, how’d you say this, illegal?,” Jenny protested. “Making you somewhat tolerable to the eyes is completely different to forcing her to fall in love with you without her knowing.”

“Ugh, fine!” Jake huffed as he crossed his arms in defeat. Jenny had devolved into a speech about ethics and morality and, though Jake would normally indulge his twin in a conversation, he wasn’t much in the mood for listening. Instead a mischievous thought popped into his mind- he and Jenny had programmed the T.R.A.M. so that those who weren’t actually in physical contact with the device at the point of exchange would be privy to the new reality formed around the disruption. Wouldn't admit it but she has a not so secret crush on Trent Lockheed, making her one of the few people that can actually stand him. Works at TG for PR and is very social and approachable.

Heather Tuzo: 21 year old concierge at IDL. Mixed race (half black, half Asian) beauty standing at 5'6". Has modest sized C cup breasts but owns a plump butt that distracts many of the men she meets. Normally holds her frizzy chestnut hair back with a hairband while wearing a turquoise IDL shirt with a sleeveless jeans jacket, leggings and comfortable trainers. In a serious relationship with lifeguard Carter Woods Jr and sister of bellhop Francis Tuzo.

Richie Kendrick: 45 year old black man. Although he is not as young as most of the other contestants are, he's very sociable and gets on with everyone. Has small square spectacles and has a shiny, bald head. Outside of work he has a family of 5 with his wife Yolanda and kids Craig, Harry and Brenda.

Magnus Kronenburg: scientist at Transformation Group. 5'8"- wears large round spectacles. A genius but is very shy, especially around Diann, who he has a crush on.

Are you ready to jump in?
14511.title: Yeah, I love them!

145111.content:
You watched on as the camera panned over a sleepy tropical island, filled with lush green vegetation and surrounded by clear sapphire waters. It was a natural masterpiece, a perfectly calm isle that lounged lazily in the Bermuda sea. You shuffled excitedly in your seat as an exotic sounding melody played, the signature tune of your new favourite show, Switching Sides.

You, along with a couple million others, gazed at the screen as the camera zoomed in on a spotless, neomodern mansion that looked stunning with its lavish stone veneer walls painted white and burgundy and orange tiled roof.

The camera zoomed in again, closing in on two figures, one male, one female, standing proudly in front of the building. The dude was RIPPED, his toned muscles bulging out of his black tank top and shorts ensemble. He had dark, mahogany skin that glistened in the sunlight, due to sweat either from the warm rays of the sun or from a recent workout session. He had a blonde buzz cut and pearly white teeth that shone a bright glare back into the camera as he smiled.

The woman was dwarfed by the large physique of the man but she was still smoking hot. She was tanned a light orange and wore a tight, black two piece tracksuit consisting of a plain hooded crop top and a pair of ripped joggers, perfect for exposing her curvy hourglass figure. She had her jet-black hair pulled into two long twin braids that ran down her slim back. Her eyes were a pretty hazel colour and she smiled, her lips curved up into a sultry smile.

The dude beamed as the camera locked in on the duo, clearly enjoying the spotlight being on his handsome face.

“Welcome, ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls, to the premiere episode of the world’s BEST reality show, Switching Sides! Hope you’re all doing well! I’m Dan...”

“And I’m Sadie,” the girl continued, speaking in a light Geordie accent. “We’re gonna be ya hosts for the next few weeks as our contestants face different challenges and obstacles for a BIG cash prize. Ain’t that right, Dan?”

“Too right, Sadie. Whoever wins the WHOLE thing wins a whopping FIVE HUNDRED GRAND in CASH! Talk about incentive!”

“Yep! But there’s a catch: even if someone does get through to the final few rounds of the competition, there’s NO guarantee that they’ll get there the same as they came in; this IS a STRANGE show, after all.”

“Because of that, losing doesn’t necessarily mean you’ve LOST- you can still win a small CONSOLATION prize if you play your cards right... Enough talking- let’s join our contestants inside...”

Dan pushed open the large door, beckoning you to go inside and watch the fun unfolding...
145111.title: Let’s go!

1451111.content:
The camera went through the regal oak doors and entered a lobby area currently occupied by all 14 of the participants. They all seemed to kill around and chat, making small talk as they waited for something eventful to happen.

They had all seperated into different groups and had begun to socialise. The first group the camera focused on consisted of two boys and two girls, all of them looking like they were in their early twenties. The guys stood and conversed casually, a natural macho chemistry shared between them. Both were quite attractive; the one standing on the left had a messy quiff sitting atop his handsome face, pushing it away to reveal brilliant, sky-blue eyes. His mahogany skin rippled with his muscular physique as he stood with his hands inside his flower print short pockets. “Whatever you say, Carter...” Drake quipped, “...As long as I’m here, you’re not winning JACK.”

His buddy Carter also had striking good looks with his attractive, tan skin with toned abs and small Afro. Although his physique was slightly worse his companion’s, he had a gorgeous face with well proportioned cheekbones, deep hazel eyes and a strong, chiseled jawline. Carter wore a simple turquoise T-shirt with the letters ’IDL’ on the front along with simple tracksuit bottoms and blacked out kicks.

The women were pretty alongside their male counterparts as well. One of them was a knockout, her smooth, olive skin glistening in the glow of the natural light coming into the room. She had frizzy chestnut hair that bounced as she erupted into laughter, her canorous howling strangely infectious. She had modest sized endowments but if you looked down you could see that she had a plump rump that strained the seams of her tight black leggings. She then hooked her arm inside Carter’s, implying they were in some sort of relationship, something the second girl momentarily frowned about before plastering a mischievous grin on top of it.

The second girl was simply drop dead gorgeous. She flicked her long, brunette hair out of her face and exposed two hypnotic turquoise eyes that seemed to ripple like a wave crashing onto a beach shore. Her plump DD cups threatened to burst out of the turquoise sports bra that she wore, attracting quick glances from many other people around the room, both in admiration and jealousy. In fact, it looked like she knew this and RELISHED the attention so she bent forwards to tie her shoelaces, exposing her cleavage to those in front and showcasing her large rear to those behind.

“Calm down, Mallory,” the girl with Carter commented, saying the girl’s name with a little bit of extra acid. “You’re gonna pop off one of the buttons from your jeans in a minute.” Mallory returned with a sarcastic thumbs up. “Noted, Heather...”

Heather returned with a fake smile before pulling Carter away, talking and laughing as they strolled off together. Mallory scoffed before she continued her conversation with Drake, both laughing as she whispered something in his ear.

“...Look at them, giggling like small children. C’est une honte!” A young woman stared daggers at the duo, mostly at Drake, as they traded whispered messages. She impatiently tapped the toe of her suede ankle boots as she crossed her slim arms across her front. Her blonde and pink hair ran down her back and was only pinned back from her face by a pair of designer glasses. She was wearing a revealing spaghetti top with skintight booty shorts hugging to every contour of her slim backside and hips.

“They might not even be talking about YOU, Anne!” said a small woman standing beside her. She was unable to stand still, twiddling one of her multicolour pigtails in her hand, fiddling with one of her many piercings or just bouncing around in general. “They could be talking about the weather, the resort, the FOOD... Oh, the food here’s AMAZING, I just had 3 eggs, 4 strips of bacon, 2 pancakes (I would’ve had more if it hadn’t run out), 4 pieces of toast...”

“Ah, non, non! Foggo, you are doing it again. Just shush and breathe... In... Out...” They both took deep breaths, calming down. This was regular for Anne-Marie; although she would count Foggo as the greatest companion she’d ever known, she had a tendency to talk A LOT and if she got started, she would NOT stop.

“Better?” Foggo nodded. “Good. Well it’s obvious they’re talking about MOI. Who else would that cold hearted, inconsiderate fils de pute be talking about?! Oh, when I get my hands on him, I’ll...” Foggo shook her head in disbelief as Anne-Marie continued ranting and slurring him in both English and French. How did these two ever get together? she wondered, nodding silently to her friend.
1451111.title: Meet the characters

choices: Fast forward to the next morning
1452.content:
Gabby shuffled uncomfortably in her seat, attempting and failing to discreetly remove her pink, lace panties from in between her buttcheeks. She silently cursed at her husband for suggesting she wear them in the morning, a gesture done more out of lust than of practicality. As she reached once more to relieve herself she felt a sharp bump on her side. 'Ow!' Gabby moaned as she turned to face her best friend and fellow secretary, Diann. 'What was that for?!'

Diann rolled her eyes as she whispered, 'First off, take your hands out of your ass, you're embarrassing both of us. Second, Lockheed's here. Gabby's head shot upwards towards the stage as a resounding applause echoed round in the packed auditorium. She watched as Old Man Lockheed, still surprisingly mobile and spry at his age, sprung onto the stage with a cocky little grin plastered on his withering face.

He basked in the applause for a few moments before halting it abruptly with a single, pale-white digit. The crowd all seemed to simultaneously hold their breath as they waited for him to say something inspiring or revolutionary. Reginald stopped also before burping loudly, an act that somehow warranted yet another round of applause. Ugh, what a pig... Gabby groaned.

"Now, now, ladies and gentlemen," Lockheed spoke with a booming voice that silenced the masses, "Sorry for that little hiccup. Sometimes I get a little bit... gassy." Another chorus of laughter erupted.

"Okay, fun aside, why have I brought you here today, esteemed members of the public. Well it's quite simple really: let me tell you of a story when I was just a boy myself and yes in fact, I once WAS a child. I remember always coming home and setting up crazy little game with my parents. You see, we couldn't afford all those fancy board games and widgets that you take for granted today so we would make our own, fantastic little tales about dragons and monsters, legendary battles that stay with me even know."

"You may be asking: But why are you telling us this Doctor Lockheed? To put it simply the days of coming back and creating whimsical ditties about princesses' and valiant knights are over- now the parents are so obsessed with work they aren't able to spend time with children as they should. In turn the children feel neglected, acting out and causing mayhem just to get a sliver of attention from the people that are supposed to be there for them. Many parents try to blame this on 'violent games and media' to deflect the blame off themeselves. Well no more."

He suddenly pulled down a curtain which had been carefully laid in the centre of the stage, eliciting a collective gasp from the crowd which Gabby couldn't even stop herself from joining in. Underneath the cover had been a pristine platinum coloured piece of machinery, a large, transparent ball with patterns and lines of code racing across the surface with a high tech setup of a chair and a headset with multiple wires and buttons.

"That's... That's... AMAZING!" Diann squealed with excitement.

Gabby fake yawned, concealing the sense of excitement that was brewing inside of her. "I dunno, it kinda looks like a giant hamster ball."

Lockheed circled the sphere intently, marvelling at his own creation. "The L.O.C.K-G20, the latest and greatest innovation in gaming technology. It has state-of-the-art gyroscopic sensors, allowing users to experience a fully immersive gaming experience without leaving the comfort of our Neo-Leather chairs with built in massage to stop cramps. Add in the all new vIDERE Goggles and Gloves to see in stunning graphics and literally FEEL your surroundings, along with the nIDORE system that sends stimuli to your nose and mouth receptors, allowing you to also taste and smell what is going on around you."

He caressed the smooth exterior of the sphere as he continued, "Why put so much effort into this labour of love? Because I want to bring back the days where EVERYONE, not just the lucky few, are able to log on and connect with not only people around the globe but the ones closest to us, the mums, the dads, the brothers, the sisters. Because THEY are the ones who matter most."

A huge round of applause came again as Lockheed bowed once more before gracefully exiting the stage. A slew of people came to congratulate him and take pictures with him but he politely declined all of them, swiftly entering his black limousine and motioning for the driver to move on. He quickly removed his tie and tossed it on the seat beside him before asking, "Did that sound convincing enough to you?"

A slow clap started as a small figure sitting across from him came into view. She smiled as she replied, "Very compelling, Uncle Reg. I especially liked the part about playing 'whimsical games' with your parents as a child. Ha! Like you remember being a child, Uncle!"

"Quit with the quips, Minnie. If you've come here there must be a reason- give me an update on the island. Were we successful?"

"Please Uncle Reg, don't flatter me, it was all YOU. And no, we were NOT successful in Project Ludum: too many guests have been trapped inside and some are starting to question their disappearances. Our vast supply of neurochips are staring to deplete."

Reginald nodded pensively as he absorbed the information. "The neurochips are a necessary sacrifice, we can always produce more. Just make sure that all the residents at the resort are sedated and oblivious to the experiments. I've put too much into this, too much I've gambled on this product."

"If we don't fix the bugs by the release date in a month's time this project is going to start haemorrhaging money. I've risked a lot too, y'know. I hope this works."

"For both of us, my dear Minnie," Lockheed said as he finally looked up from his lap to stare at his great niece. "For the both of us."
1452.title: A New Reality...

choices: a fantasy land, filled with orcs, wizards and hobbits
14521.content:
06:48AM, SOMEWHERE IN THE COUNTRYSIDE, ENGLAND
-- -- -- --- - - -- --- ---- - ---- --- --- -- --- --

"Are you sure this is COMPLETELY safe?" Gabby asked as she nervously sat down in her chair. She and most of the other members of staff had been told weeks prior that they were being volunteered to partake in a revolutionary new tech display but that didn't help to stop the trembling in her hands. She, as with all the Transforming Genetics employees had been given pressed, sleeveless black jumpsuits with blue and gold trim to wear. 'Mandatory uniform is good for team morale,' Lockheed had quipped. To Gabby it just meant that it would be easier for the scientists to keep track of the rats.

"For the SIX-HUNDRETH time, Gabby, we're gonna be just FINE!" Gabby looked sideways at Diann Dickson, her BCFL (Best Coworkers For Life, duh), looking as chipper as always. She had a huge grin plastered onto her face that not only brightened the room but calmed Gabby's rising nerves. "You just need to lighten up! Come on, how many times will you and me experience something like THIS, TOGETHER?!"

Gabby sarcastically rolled her eyes as she said, "Aren't you a little worried that we had to sign liability waivers right before we were allowed into this place? Something's just a little bit off, isn't it?"

"Pfft, whatever you say 'Detective Bronson-Carter'! All I know is that I'm getting a minimum of 2 days away from that cockwad Reggie and his loser friends. I seem to remember someone saying I shouldn't have married him right before I did it, ain't that right Gabrielle?"

Gabby laughed as she replied, "Well, I'm not the one to talk. My first one... Ooh, that was bad. Imagine if E.T. and Jack Black had a baby, gave it some really crappy rock music and a ponytail and named him Barry freakin' Henderson!"

They both giggled like naughty schoolgirls as a loud klaxon erupted around the laboratory, signalling for them to prepare themselves to enter the game. "Good luck!" Gabby shouted over the deafening noise.

"I don't need luck! Right now, I just need a sandwich!"

Gabby laughed as the opening of her pod was lowered and sealed off, preventing her from making any last minute escapes. Okay, this is it Gabby, this is it... She adjusted her butt in the seat before she slipped on the hi-tech gloves which literally formed and shaped themselves to the exact dimensions of her hands. She brushed a loose strand of chestnut brown hair from her pale blue eyes as she heard a tinny voice counting down from 10 from somewhere inside the sphere.

She finally put on the headset and gritted her teeth as she heard the voice carry on counting: "5... 4... 3... 2... 1... WELCOME TO L.O.C.K G-20. WE HOPE YOU ENJOY YOUR EXPERIENCE." Suddenly, Gabby felt a tugging sensation on her head, no, her mind, pulling her subconscious through a tunnel of information and code, making her scream vehemently as she felt she was being hurled along on the world's greatest rollercoaster.

Nearly as soon as the sensations started they abruptly stopped. Gabby hesitantly peeked out, expecting there to be nothing but a bottomless drop in front of her. She was even more surprised when she saw that the world in front of her was:
14521.title: Fast forward to the next morning

145212.content: What character was Gabby playing as?
145212.title: a fantasy land, filled with orcs, wizards and h...

choices: “...chance it and learn as we go.”
1452123.content:
“AAAAHHHHHHhhhh... ah?” Gabby’s scream eventually came to halt as her consciousness completed its journey through the vortex and now she was back onto Earth. Well, maybe not the Earth she knew. From the repugnant stench of old mead, horse crap and blood mixed together with the sight of what seemed like an army of drunken revellers scattered around her, bantering playfully, locking horns and drinking like liver poisoning wasn’t a thing. Wait, locking HORNS?! Gabby stared idly, mouth agape, as a pair of unicorns engaged in a fierce tussle, slashing and stabbing with their horns as seedy looking men exchanged gold coins and cheered on.

’Ok Gabby, get it together; this isn’t real, it’s not possible, it’s not~’ She gagged in her mouth and vomited, expelling the remains of what she hoped was chicken and rice. She spotted a barrel of water by a back wall and dashed towards it, travelling nimbly and precisely before throwing up the rest of her stomach behind it. Disgusted, she wiped her mouth with her hand. Her face screwed up with perplexion as she realised she was no longer wearing the blue and gold trimmed jumpsuit from before. ’No, definitely not,’ she thought as she did a double take and realised that her whole attire had changed. Adorned on her body was a skimpy, impractical set of armour straight out of the dreams of a thirsty fantasy nerd. Beautiful silks of aquaramine and black weaved around her abnormally svelte curves, covering every expanse of her body excluding her meaty thighs and her (conveniently exposed) boobs. She wore beautiful full length.boots made of routinely polished leather with gold leaf patterns sprinkled around for extra pizzaz.

“What the~!” Her hands shot up and cupped her face which had changed too. Her features had all rounded out, giving her a demeanour that simultaneously made her seem 10 and 20 at the same time. Her nose had shrunk down completely whilst her eyes had grown disproportionately. She reached up and touched her ears, feeling a tiny pinprick from their pointy, long vertices. The only things that hadn’t really been altered were her eye colour and hair albeit the latter had grown so that it descended all the way to the small of her back.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/f5/dd/e2/...

“How the hell did this happen?! Oh geez, oh geez...” Gabby started hyperventilating as her mind went into total meltdown. She grabbed a rail on the wall to steady herself, her knuckles whitening as her vice like grip intensified, eventually resulting in a portion of it (and a small chunk of wall) breaking off. “Sorry,” she apologised to the trollish bartender that hollered what she assumed was the equivalent of several racial slurs and misogynistic comments in their unknown native tongue, before scurrying off in embarrassment. She had half a mind to slip out by herself to try and make some sense of the place she was in when she heard a familiar voice crying out from a table with elves jumping and giggling round it.

Gabby stepped closer and a smile spread across her face. “Get off me you uneducated oafs! How dare you lay a hand on the heir and future face of the Lockheed family! Oh, when my father hears about this he’ll...” Gabby began giggling which alerted the attention of the bullying elves. They all scurried away quickly- well, all except for one stout looking one which wobbled away at an alarming pace. The figure on the table stood up slowly, dusting themselves down before spitting in the direction of the fleeing elves and throwing them a ‘wanker’ sign. They couldn’t have been taller than the size of Gabby’s palm but it was clear they had an air of importance about themself. The little pixie may have seemed cute because of its petite size but it was clear that it’s attire was intended to be edgy and dark- it was a gothic combination of mint and ebony, beginning with shoulder-cropped black hair with green highlights leading to a revealing, shoulder-less leaf green dress with hooped fingerless gloves which resulted in long, black stilettos that seemed more fashionable than practical.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/81/b4/91/...

“T-Trent? Is that... you?”

The creature swivelled round and scowled at Gabby with an expression that could freeze hell over. “Of course it’s me, you stupid dolt. Ugh, you’d think that all the idiots were left back in the real world so we could escape from their stupidity. I swear, if I get my hands on those fat, little dweebs, I’m gonna make them...”

“Wait, real world? Does that mean- of course, we’re in the game!”

“Thank you Captain Obvious, it’s not like that was the most rational explanation from the very beginning! Why do you think you’re stuck in that sluttish elf and I’m forced to inhabit this pitiful pixie! I swear, whoever sabotaged me right before we went in and swiped away the Knight that I’d begged Father for is going to feel my wrath! Be glad that you’ve at least retained your normal genitalia- the so-called men here have been eyeing me up since i dropped down...”

“I don’t remember picking this character though- I chose the farmer’s wife because it had the lowest difficulty. Something must’ve gone wrong- did the brain-suck-thingamajig feel just a bit too rough too you?”

“I think you mean the Insertion,” Trent Pixie scoffed, “but I do understand what you mean- Father’s machinations have never been anything but smooth and comfortable for its users. He and my cousin were complaining about some bugs before but I thought nothing of it at the time. Surely he wouldn’t~” Trent’s face scrunched up into an expression of perplexed wonder before transitioning into one of utmost fear. He pulled down the hooped gloves and exposed his wrist to the world, frantically clawing at the flesh.

“What’re you doing?!” Gabby’s eyes bulged as he replied, “Trying to find the callback switch! Crap, crap, oh God no..!” After a few more moments Trent gave up and sprawled on the table, exasperated. “Oh crap. When all employees were fitted into their custom uniforms, a small switch was sewn into the seams near the wrist in order to instantaneously return its wearer back to reality in case of mental breakdown or malfunction, thus the term ’callback’. But for whatever reason, the switch isn’t responding.”

“Which means...”

“Which means we can’t get out,” Trent continued. There was silence for a moment. “We’re stuck here for the time being. Luckily our bodies on the outside are connected to feeding tubes and other instruments to maintain our stasis for a while. However, our minds? If we run out of lives and die, there’re no resurrections- it’s permadeath mentally and eventually physically.”

“W-Woah. That’s... Is there anything we can do to try and get out before that happens?”

“Well, I honestly don’t know. Most games let you leave once you’ve completed its campaign so that might be the most straightforward way out. Or maybe... If we had someone with the technological know-how to do it, we could try and hack into the very software of the game and engineer a way to eject ourselves out! But I don’t know how to do that in the first place.”

Gabby scratched her chin in thought before blurting out, “Ooh! I know: some of the other employees were chosen as testers as well right? So if we can locate someone smart like Tim, Aamil or the Twins we can definitely find a way to bust out without risking our lives!” They both smiled at each other, embracing uncharacteristically where Gabby crushed Trent’s face into the midst of her massive mounds. “Crushing... Me...” he whispered softly. Gabby relinquished him and set him back onto the table.

“Finally, you desk jockeys are showing some initiative!” Trent quipped. “Only problem is how we do that exactly. We have no experience of this place, no knowledge about our surroundings and no comprehension of the creatures co-existing with us in this hellhole. In this virtual world, we’re sitting ducks.”

Gabby thought for a moment about her reply. “Hmm... Well, let’s____”
1452123.title: A scantily clad mystical archer?

choices: “Let’s find a way out of this town.”
14521231.content:
Gabby thought for a moment about her reply. “Hmm... Well, let’s find ourselves a guide.” Trent tried to scrunch his face in perplexion but his cute pixie face made the expression downright laughable. He shook his head and slapped his palm onto his forehead. “Were you not listening to the speech I just gave you? We’ve no idea where we are, let alone where we can stumble across someone friendly enough to help us navigate without killing us where we stand. You go ahead, I’m staying right here, where it’s safe.” Trent crosses his arms and huffed rebelliously. Gabby rolled her eyes. God, the urge to crush him underneath her fist was nearly overwhelming. Even so, Trent was the only person she knew wasn’t actively planning to murder her and so was her only ally for now, albeit a reluctant one.

“Well what do you expect me to do Trent? I can’t just...” Gabby’s pointy ears perked up as she heard a relatively large group of voices coming towards them from their western side. She sneaked a glance and noticed that one of the elves she’d scared off had dropped a purse of money into the bartender’s palm as his other cohorts stared at the duo maliciously. “Trent, I think we really have to go.” Too late. The bartender had already ambled his way round his booth and locked the doors to the exit. At the same time the elves seemed to have magicked a paraphernalia of weapons out of thin air, some holding wooden bows, others holding makeshift clubs of sorts, and the fat bastard of the lot had picked up a menacing looking spiked mace. Finally Trent realised that something was awry. “Oh sh*t,” he said quietly as he cupped his hand to his ear, “Oh God, they’re arguing over how they’re going to split up our carcasses...”

Gabby looked at the pixie-boy incredulously. All she could hear was high pitched warbling with the occasional click of the teeth. “How are you understanding them,” she asked to which Trent just shrugged his shoulders, shaking uncontrollably in his dainty green dress. The same terror was starting to take root in Gabby’s heart as well but she pushed it down and suppressed it, a voice in the back of her head telling her that her fear was a needless distraction. Without warning, she picked up Trent and stuffed him into her bosom, blocking out his insufferable whining as she did so. She closed her eyes instinctively. She didn’t even think as she reached behind her back, pulling something rigid and strong from out of thin air. Gabby looked down onto her left hand and gasped—a masterfully crafted bow had appeared in her hand, a beautiful thing as tall as she was with a sparkling obsidian base and wickedly sharp edges made of gold. New information flooded into her mind, memories of countless hours of practice, instincts that seemed alien to her that had been honed and refined to near perfection.

Her left hand gripped the riser of the bow, just below the centre, and she wondered where she’d learnt the terminology. Her right hand reached behind her once more and returned to her waist, clutching an ornate arrow with a deadly point on the end. She rested the nock of the arrow onto the bowstring and pulled back, hearing it groan from the strain but refuse to yield. She looked back up to the elfin gang who were slowly advancing towards them. Weirdly enough, a white circle, kind of like a scope sight, appeared in Gabby’s line of vision. She blinked twice but still it remained there. She was pleasantly surprised when she looked at each of the elves in turn and observed that the circle turned red and circled around their heads, vital organs and other weak points. “Unhand me you lowly desk-jockey!,” Trent squealed from inside Gabby’s breasts. However his screams were muffled and fell onto deaf ears.

A particularly bloodthirsty elf broke away from his pack and charged straight at Gabby, brandishing his wooden club high in the air. Almost instantaneously, Gabby had drawn her bow and let off a single shot, the arrow twirling majestically before hitting the elf square in his forehead, rupturing his skull and piercing through his tissue until it flew out through the other side. The elf had been taken so quickly that his mind hadn’t had time to process his passing and his body took a few more steps until collapsing onto the cobblestoned floor below. His club splintered as it crashed out of his hand, rolling lifelessly until it came to an eventual stop. Everyone in the bar had stopped and turned to look at the elf. Even Gabby was shocked at the precise brutality of what she’d done. No one made a sound. Suddenly the chunkiest elf roared a cry of vengeance and charged, his comrades following behind him.

Still came the same results. Thwack! One elf rocketed backwards into a barrel of mead, the golden drink turning dark and thick. Thwack! Another one received an arrow in his arms for his troubles, stumbling back and crashing into two of his cohorts. Thwack! This especially unlucky fellow was a victim of Gabby’s growing confidence and received a direct hit that ruptured both of his testicles; no, he may not have died that day but the ensuing pain made him wish that he would have. The number of elves attacking dwindled as rapidly as Gabby’s arrows depleted. Somehow she had the exact number she had left lodged in the back of her mind. Seventeen...Sixteen... An elven archer that tried to flank her from the side soon had an iron tip lodged in his abdomen. Fifteen. The rest of the elves scattered. Most of them had already been a bit tipsy before the short-lived confrontation and struggled to make their escape, stumbling into each other and the wooden support beams before wobbling their way out the back entrance. ”Hukaa Xhan!,” the chunky elf hollered at Gabby as he limped away nursing an arrow inside his left bum cheek.

“What does that mean?,” Gabby said absentmindedly. It was then that Trent decided he wanted to pop his head out, squirming his way out of Gabby’s gelatinous orbs and clumsily back down onto the table below. “Oh f*ck,” he groaned as he stretched out his back. “Your boobs, while as juicy and as warm as they are, are absolutely ridiculous to rest in. Completely useless. Anyways, I’m pretty sure that he said something along the lines of ‘Slut B*tch’ but I can’t verify that.” Trent looked around the room and gawked at the sheer amount of bodies littered around the floor, each in a varied state of agony with arrows lodged in and around their corpses. It was roughly 3 years ago when Connor and Nicholas had been attempting to intercept a jewel on it's way to a museum in Morocco. Jared was in another side of the city, laying low after having busted into one of the museum employees houses, ransacking it to gain intel on the transfer.

They had tracked the jewel in it's armored truck and set up an ambush as it stopped to refuel. Nicholas was in the car, due to Connor being the one needed to input the code used to unlock the car. Nicholas was a lookout for Connor, trying to stay awake after the hours of tirelessly tracking the truck. As Nicholas was beginning to doze off, a figure slipped under his sight, the daylight seeping away into twilight.

Savannah Shaw was clad in her black cat suit. It wasn't subtle, if you could even see her, that is. It was form over flare, and right now she knew where she needed to be and what to do.

Savannah jumped onto the back of the armored car and faced Connor as he jumped and turned at the sudden noise.

"Relax. It's me.", Savannah said. Connor took a breath of relief.

"Thank god. Thought I was busted for a second.", he said before turning back to continue with the keypad in front of him.

"We've got to stop meeting like this...", Savannah said.

"Tell me about it.", Connor said, his fingers still working diligently. "I hope you weren't here to take this jewel. I'm afraid I've worked far too hard on this."

"I was thinking if I help you get it out of here I could have a cut.", Savannah said, placing one hand on her hip. "After all, you DO know about the silent alarm on the trucks rear doors, right?"

"Silent alarm?", Connor said, turning, his eyes wide.

"Better hurry.", Savannah said. "I could slow them down, but we know my price."

"Fine. Just do it.", Connor said, eager to not let this plan blow up in his face.

3 minutes later Connor's fingers finished their work and an audible click was heard. In his hurry he never noticed Savannah had never left him.

"What are you...", he said, before he was interrupted with Savannah's lips locking with his own.

Savannah pulled back. "So sorry, but you really should have expected this.", she said as she smoothly pulled out a pair of handcuffs and secured them around one of Connor's wrists, then the railing on the seat in the armored truck.

Savannah went around him and grabbed the case with the jewel and hopped out of the truck. "I'll see you soon, hun. Hope the feds go easy on you."

In a matter of seconds, Savannah was gone, leaving only Connor to mull over his fate.

Connor, knowing shouting would only speed up his arrest, sat, fuming. He used his free hand to reach up and trigger the earpiece he used to communicate to Nicholas. "Hey Nick, I'm gonna need an emergency evac. Jared, if you see Savannah Shaw, STOP HER."

Needless to say Jared didn't stop Savannah, or even find her. Connor was lucky that Nicholas had gotten there in time and they both avoided a lengthy jail sentence.

In the current day, Connor was walking with purpose to the party, intent on finding Savannah and giving her a piece of all those times she'd left him hung to dry.

"Hey big guy. Name's Ethan Porter." Connor said, only slowing to a slow walk as he moved toward the gate.

The guard flicked through his clip board with thin, manicured fingers. "Thank you sir, enjoy your evening."

"You too.", Connor said, brushing the guard's slender shoulder as he walked by.

Jared picked up the wallet again to find more information on who he'd mugged. "Ooh, Lord Basilton," he mocked in a fake royal accent, "So terribly sorry, your Highness, that I've done this ATROCITY upon you." He laughed again as he stuffed the wallet back inside the bag.

"Hmm..." Jared's interest piqued as he browsed the rest of Lord Basilton's possessions. One obvious observation were the few beer cans left inside, showing the man possibly had a drinking problem. Some were peculiar: a single, red rose, expensive men's cologne, a couple of strawberries and some chocolate (which had melted since it had been put there).

It was only when Jared had bent down and pulled out a pink, plastic dildo that everything clicked into place- unfortunately for him he realised a fraction too late as a large tree branch smashed into his back. He crumpled to the floor as an attractive, 20ish stood over him panting. She threw the improvised club to one side as she went to attend to Lord Basilton (who was still out cold).

Jared tentatively opened his left eye to see his assailant crouching by the aristocrat he'd knocked out before. "He, he," Jared chuckled as he rose slowly from the forest floor. "You should have aimed for the head."

He jumped up and tackled the woman, both of them rolling forwards as they were locked in close combat. Embarrassing for Jared though, as he'd had the element of surprise as well, the woman fought back relentlessly, not allowing Jared to gain the upper hand.

After a few seconds of intense struggling, Jared felt a tingle ripple across his body as his vision went red; he didn't realise at first but:
